(They also fooled my wife).

If wearing real pants is a 3 in terms of comfort - - - and wearing pajamas is a 10 in terms of comfort - - - i would rate these pants a 7 or 8.  I'm really impressed - hopefully they'll hold up well.

Only thing I would change is there are no belt loops.  So it would be nice when forced to dress up to be able to still wear a belt.

Pajama Jeans and these cords are just great! The fabric is soft and yet durable.  The mustard color looks more gold to me than brown but not in a garish sort of way.  The waist band has a tie in it if they needed to be synched in but I find they fit me just perfectly.  There is a stretch to all of the pajama jeans and cords, which make them very comfortable to wear and sit in.  It also prevents them from getting saggy midway through the day. I do not have a very pronounced back side or big thighs, if I did they may have fit me differently. I weigh 147 and bought size 4-6, and am 5 ft 3.  I can wear a heal with them or flats and let them touch the ground.  They are boot cut in style. You can wash and dry them without shrinkage though they are always tighter just out of the dryer than after wearing them for a while.  The waist band does not open so you have to pull them up over your hips and stomach, just as an fyi.  The waist is not stretchy, but the pants have stretch in them like jeans do.  They do not feel like yoga pants or swetpants.
summary: Love pajama jeans for comfort and style

reviewText:
Wow - that is all I can say.  I have had my eye on the Nike Flash jacket for a long time, but could not bring myself to spend 300-350 for it.  It is exactly what I wanted, an all reflective, lightweight coat for late night walks.  Perhaps the Nike jacket would be better to run in - I don't know, but I have a nice Nathans Bib for that.

Now - the jacket -

It is BRIGHT - if you have any experience with retro-reflective clothing, you know the look.  Dull grey, with a shimmer to it.  When in dark conditions...you are a light bulb.  The overall feel of the coat, is that of a rubber(ish) rain slicker - just as they advertise it.  Its feels heavier and stiffer than a Gore-Tex shell.  It is nylon lined, so at least it is more comfortable than a cheap rain coat.

Sizing - order big!!  I consider myself a medium guy.  I wear medium shirts, medium jackets.  I am 5'10", 180 lbs.  I ordered a XXL - and I'm glad I did.  The length and width of the jacket is comfortable - very US "medium".  The arms hit right at my wrists, while right at my sides.  When I extend my arms, it is a little bit short.

Measurements for my arms/torso:
Arms - From the tip of the shoulder bone: 23 - 23.5"
Arms - From the neck line of my t-shirt: 29"
Torso - From the neck line of my t-shirt (collar bone/sternum) to the bottom of my belt buckle: 21"
summary: Absolutely Wonderful low cost alternative to the Nike Flash.  Sizing runs very small...

The jacket run really small. If you can, order 2 size larger than what is

Very good quality jacket and service was excellent. Looks exactly as the photos depict. Jacket is waterproof which is nice. Fits a bit small so maybe go 2 or 3 sizes up as the jacket comes in asian sizes if you're an american or european buyer. Overall, great service and product.

summary: Glow for saftey sake... This is for everyone that needs to be seen. Buy two i did.

reviewText: Way too small.

First, this is probably the most reflective jacket I have ever seen.  It even glows hanging on the back of the kitchen chair with filtered sunlight hitting it.
Now the cons:
1. Hood is not removable which is a negative
2. The Jacket does not breath at all.  Repeat, not at all.  It's OK because I'm wearing this for night bicycle riding in the dark and don't get too warm with it zipped up but sleeves are noticeably wet and need to be turned inside out to dry after using
3. Runs very small. - I usually wear an XL and bought a 4XL so I could wear a thermal shirt underneath.  It's just about right size wise.  I'd recommend going up two sizes from normal at least.
4. They recommend spot cleaning by hand with water.  Since it doesn't breath it would be nice to wash.  I've been rinsing in the shower and letting it dry in the shower afterwards
summary: Would buy this again but a few things could stand improvement

However, that wasn't even the main problem with them. These gloves are partially woven with rabbit fur and the hair sheds EVERYWHERE. Whatever fabric surface these gloves touch will be left with a trail of hundreds of hairs - as bad as a shedding dog or cat. The hair will be stuck to your shirt, pants, car seats, inside of your purse or travel bag... everywhere. I spent more time lint rolling hairs off of me and my things than actually wearing the gloves.

reviewText: I absolutely love this costume. I usually don't order costumes offline because I like to try them on before I order them. However, since it was cutting it close to Halloween and I really had no way of getting to a store, I decided to order this costume. I was skeptical, of course, but I seriously love this costume. YES, the fabric for the skirt and the cape are going to be cheap, but come on, look at the price! The top is a nice fleece and the symbol is a stitching that was a little messed up on mine but nothing that a few snips from the scissors couldn't fix. The skirt and top are attached, the cape is attached by velcro so it would be removed, and the belt is separate. I am 5'6" and around 150 lbs and I got a Medium. Sadly, the costume is a little loose for my taste, but I was mainly worried about it being short, but it's not! The belt is really really big, I don't know why, so I think I might cut it and use safety pins to hold it together because there is no way to tighten it because it is also velcro attach in the back. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend it to people looking for a cute costume!

It is a pleasure to review this clever red hoodie from A Bathing Ape (WORLD GONE MAD 1993-2093) which I received in exchange for an honest review. This 100% polyester cloth is thick and warm with the most amazing hood which is decorated with the felt  initials W,G,M for World Gone Mad as well as felt  shark teeth, stars, flames,  Picasso style tiger, and large glaring eyes. The sturdy zipper closes easily and the two large  front pockets hold a multitude of items such as my cell phone, car keys, dog leash, work swipe card, tissues, and wallet. What I like most about this sturdy hoodie besides its clever hood design is how warm it is. The only drawback to the hoodie is that it is not machine washable (probably to protect the felt designs sewed to the hood).

reviewText:

Sexy corpse indeed.

I'm extremely happy with this purchase and I can't wait to wear it Saturday night!

THINGS TO KNOW:

Dress is really short - but I knew that based on the picture here. Wear tights or boyshorts underneath and call it a day.

It's cheap fabric - but I knew that since I bought at a super cheap price. Want quality? Pay hundreds of dollars.

Dress comes with detachable train, veil, garter, gloves and choker.

Dress top (from boob area to waist) has some type of cheap lace (that I happen to like). Dress bottom has that satin look to it. Under the flair part, it has a layer of tulle attached, which does the same thing a single layer petticoat would do.  I actually love this because it gives the dress a lil fluff.  There's a zipper on the back of the dress. Dress has elastic spaghetti straps - that you can cut off if you're into the strapless thing.

COLOR: dress is white. And it looks dirty. It's meant to look dirty since it's a CORPSE. I'm not sure if the bride is a burnt victim and the "stains" are meant to be smoke stains... Or if she was buried with her wedding dress and now she's all dirty.  Whatever. The "stains" are blackish/grayish color and they are on the front and back of the dress. Stains can also be seen on the accessories (veil, train and the other stuff).

SIZING: I actually took a chance here. They had what they call "Free Size" stating the measurements to be: Bust: "88cm/34.6" Waist: 76cm/29.9". This dress fit me like it was made for me. For your reference MY measurements are as follow: Bust 36C (or 34D), Waist: 28, the hips measurements do not matter since the dress is only tight on the breast/torso area.  THE DRESS DOES NOT HAVE A LOT OF STRETCH so if you have bigger breasts/waist than me, don't buy this as you will not fit in it.

All in all, the crappy picture they have here of the costume, is pretty much what you get. No lies there.

Totally worth the twenty something bucks I paid for it. I'm definitely a happy camper.

Happy Halloween y'all!

reviewText: It was relatively easy to replace the OEM pins on my Suunto Core with the new lugs. To prevent the replacement screw heads for the new pins from backing out, use Loctite Blue (or a comparable thread locker) on their screw  threads during assembly. The only thing to note is that with this setup (wearing a NATO-style band), the watch sits a bit higher on my wrist. The Core is a 'bulky' watch anyway, so this isn't too much of a problem for me.

I purchased this in addition to the Premium 24mm 3-ring PVD Solid Black Urban Military Nylon Nato Watch Strap G-10 Fits All Watches!!! to replace the original rubber wrist band that came stock with my Suunto Core. As you can see from the pictures, it went on great. It's overall profile is a little higher than it used to be, but that can't be helped with a NATO style band. Overall I'm very happy with how it turned out.
summary: Great Adapter for the Suunto band

reviewText: Very nice . I used these for my old Timex Hooks that had a similar lug set that you can't get parts for anymore . The size was a perfect fit with a tiny amount of trimming to the watch for clearance . Also works with the Timex Blazer and the Timex Magnum 200 watches though the Magnum is about 2mm shorter between lugs so some washers might be necessary . I would recommend blue 242 Loctite threadlocker as most kits come with it but this kit does not . You don't want the tiny screws working out and getting lost . Nice kit otherwise .

reviewText: Very leased
the wool seems cheap

I was looking forward to this skirt as I love the color and wanted a robust, woolen, winter garment.  .Besides being too small (I ordered the largest size, XL),  I'm not sure about  the term, woolen.  The skirt is soft, as in flannel, on the outside, and scratchy on the inside.  It may be a blend.  The lining is not full length, nor is the skirt "long maxi" for me (I'm 5ft. 2 or less, 118 lb)---it's more an ankle length.  I was confused about the use of the words "slim fit pleated expansion." (maybe all the skirts under the heading Expansion Skirt aren't actually that).  I was thinking maybe the skirt had a partial expandable or elastic waist, which could be somewhat forgiving, but not so.  It would be really smart to call or email the owner of the shop and ask questions---give your dimensions.
summary: Sizing is important---call or email for help.

reviewText: This product was broken when delivered
I punched someone the day i got it and broke the band #USMC

First off, this was packaged really well. In plastic, in a case, then in a box, shipped in a padded envelope so there was no crushing. The watch itself is well made and directions easy enough to understand. (Not from China where you have to decipher even their English translations).
The only con for me is that the face itself is super huge. I have small wrists, and I'm a woman, and I didn't read the size. It's nearly the same width as my wrist. Not a big deal, I like large watches. I did however have to punch another hole to get it tight. Again, my own mistake for not reading closely.
All in all it's a good buy. I have a feeling it'll last for some time.

As you can see from the picture I thought this watch would have a luminescent display with all of the numbers, markers and LED letters and numbers glowing in a rich bright green color. It did not and the backlight could barely light up the LED sections. The dial color was only brown and the LED sections were difficult to see and impossible to see at night. I did like the way the watch felt and looked on my wrist. I plan on purchasing one of the other styles that will definitely have the green glowing display. But, PLEASE take this picture off of the internet adds, it's just TOO misleading and disappointing to get in the mail and only have to return it.

reviewText: I ordered according to the size chart and it fit fine. I am taking a vacation in January and wanted a lightweight coat that was warm enough to get me to the Chicago airport but wouldn't take up much space once I get to my destination. This one will work, although I do wish it were a bit longer...it will be fine layered over a sweater or longer shirt but it's very short.

I probably could have gotten XL, but this gives me room to wear a sweater under the jacket.  I have short arms, so the arm length was not a problem.  The jacket itself is very light and seems well made.  It packs into the small bag that comes with it, great for travel, which is the main reason I bought it.  I haven't had a chance to use it yet, so I don't know how well it will keep me warm in 40 degree weather.  I'll have to do an update after I've had a chance to wear it and wash it.  Four stars on look and feel.

reviewText:
This coat is much better than I expected. It is very warm, with plenty of features and options. For instance the fur is detachable as is the hood. The waist is adjustable on the inside for a tighter fit. It has buttons and a 2-way zipper for closing the coat. The inner collar lining is also detachable!

Overall it handles rain and wind well. The coldest temperature I've worn it in was about 25 degrees Fahrenheit with a strong wind and I remained perfectly warm. What more could you ask for? I also own a $300+ Eddie Bauer all weather coat and I really couldn't point out a substantial difference in performance. The bottom line is this is a nice coat.
summary: Better than it looks and it looks nice

reviewText:
This is a pretty little skirt that I'm sure I'll get a lot of use out of. It's a big lighter weight than I was expecting, so I'll end up wearing it more in the warmer months, but that's okay, since I wear skirts a lot in the spring and summer.

These are sized small, which they were upfront about, but I went by the measurements, not my normal size, and chose a "large," which seems to fit nicely. The color in the picture is a deep pink, but it was labeled purple, and other reviewers said it was more purple, which was more what I wanted. It turned out to be a pretty medium purple shade. They might find it helpful to people to re-photograph the skirt in a light that picks up the color more accurately.

It seems like a nice length for warm weather. I'm not sure whether or not I'll stick with that bow. If I decided to get rid of it, it's just tacked on and will be easy to remove. Maybe I can just move it around to the back.

But bow or no bow, I think I'll enjoy the skirt once warmer weather rolls around.

reviewText: This skirt can fit like a glove or not. I ordered a Medium skirt last year (I typically fit into a 6 in women's sizes) but I have what I would call a unique hip/waist curvature that can make high waist skirts and pants awkward looking. Decided to try this skirt anyway because everyone looked so cute in their "Review" photos and I thought it would be perfect for an upcoming social event! My initial fit was not great. The skirt hugged my waist a bit too tight and created slight stomach rolls/lumps over the top of the skirt. Not so cute. I contemplated returning it, but fortunately for me, my new job had me running around so much that I lost a few inches in my waist right before the event. I slipped into the skirt the day of the party, and it fit great and got plenty of attention. My suggestion: Check your measurements with the sizing chart. If you can order the correct size, you won't be disappointed. It's a beautiful skirt, and of course, POCKETS!

So, I look at all the other reviews prior to purchasing and decided to give this outfit a try regardless. For the price, my expectations low to avoid disappointment. The picture look like cotton/polyester type but the actual fabric is chiffon as it clearly states in the description. So my advise is be mindful of your underwear color choices (strictly black undies only in my case). The stitching quality was somewhat poor in some areas but again, for the price I somewhat expected that. I ordered a size XL seeing that most people reported that it ran small, I usually wear large. When you take it straight out the package and put it on, you'll probably be like WTF is this (the orange look like I escaped from prison)....but after adding some contrast accessories, belting the waist and pinning up the leg ruffles, it came alive. I actually like this lil outfit. Hope this helps :)

reviewText: The item was as described and arrived in excellent condition. The lens are the usual outstanding Maui Jim quality.

I bought these for duty back in 2013. I ordered the matte black frame with the black, bronze, green HT, and clear lenses. I was looking for a sunglasses SYSTEM for work that would allow me to interchange lenses depending on the weather conditions. I had Laser Eye Surgery back in 2001 and i've always been a little sensitive to the light....I've been using sunglasses almost daily since. I really like the Oakley Radar shield style but I'm not a fan of the optics.

Please note. I use these sunglasses DAILY and they get tossed around quite a bit. I swap the lenses out sometimes twice in one shift and I use a micro fibre cloth for cleaning. The case that Maui Jims sends is FANTASTIC. I can house the sunglasses (with a Lens) and 3 additional lenses in the same case....4 lenses in total in 1 case!!!! I keep these stuffed in my duty bag and after vigorous use the case still looks good.

There are some negatives to these sunglasses. I found that after a year the matte finish started to wear off on the frames. I also noted that the middle button on the bridge has stopped working. It would depress but was not clicking into the lenses. The beauty of these lenses is that the side clicks can support the lens without the middle...but the middle button definitely has a design flaw. I also found that there are some distress points and cracking on the bridge of the lenses (especially the bronze)....this I assume is due to frame flexing during daily wear.

If this was any other brand I'd probably one star these and move on. But I can't say enough about the optics of Maui Jim lenses....for that reason alone I keep using these for work despite the flaws. The bronze lenses on most days are a treat....I love these lenses the most. During our blazing summers I'm usually rocking the black lenses. For our overcast rainy days (we have lots in Vancouver) I like to use the Maui HT Green lenses (despite my colleague commenting on how the green makes him feel depressed). I opted against getting the Rose lenses because I felt that I was doubling up with the Maui HT Green.....My colleague uses the Maui Rose and finds those optics pleasing.

I did contact Maui Jim a few years back complaining about the bridge button and other issues. They told me to send them in for an evaluation. Life got in the way and I missed the 2 year window for warranty coverage.....my bad....not theirs. I've used Maui Jim warranty coverage in the past for nose pieces etc on other sunglasses and a colleague sent his Switchbacks in and had them fixed without any issues.

I am waiting for Maui Jim to release another style of interchangeable lenses.....until then I will continue to use these until they fall apart....which I predict will happen within 2 years.
summary: I LIKE THEM.......BUT THEY'RE NOT PERFECT

I did figure out that if you wear the skirt with the snaps facing the side (instead of the front, as pictured) then they're less likely to pop open (but still do, occasionally). I eventually just stopped wearing them.

Overall, these skirts are cheap and they look cute but you're probably better off trying something else. It sucks that I can't wear these skirts the way I intended without worrying about public nudity! I'm thinking about getting some buttons and cutting in buttonholes.

reviewText: Looks and feels like silk.  Very nice robe!!!!!!!
a nice practical skirt

This robe puts me in mind of the old "Elvis" and "Jesus" velour paintings.  The material is soft and light weight.  It's very shiny material, not quite the classier look I see in the picture.  The red is very Coca Cola-can bright red and the white areas (especially in the roses) makes the contrast a bit more "startling."  Think very shiny.  This robe/gown all but screams "Made in China."  Looks well made though.  The black area is heavy and stiff (satiny ribbon texture).  That might be more preferred as it holds the gown to a shape it would definitely not have due to the thin and soft texture of the velour.  The gown tag says 100% polyester.  I don't see that as a con, though.  The gown meets my criteria.  I wanted something with a zipper, that covered well for a fall trip.  The length is just a tad shorter than I would have liked and I'm 5'6."  That could be a plus to some people who don't want floor length.  It hits me right about top ankle.  That being said, I wasn't looking for beauty so much as coverage and functionality.  You can definitely wad this up in a ball and crush in a suitcase and pop it out at your destination without a wrinkle in sight.  For what I wanted, I would recommend.  But it isn't as pretty as it looks in the picture.

I am looking forward to using this to wear around the house postpartum because it will allow me to breastfeed and do skin-to-skin with my newborn using a baby wrap underneath the robe. summary: People won't stop looking at me

reviewText:
The items(2 sunglasses) arrived without any air cushion, running around in a big box.
The outer part of Tom Ford paper box was squashed (no surprises with no cushions or any air bags inside).
The sunglasses were big and awkward.

My fellow Amazon customers, here's my dear advice:
when you receive the item, check these things:
- The serial number on the left temple tip must match the serial number on the box (under the barcode)
- The original glasses come with an authenticity card. Check (letters, font) if they are consistent with the Tom Ford logo (aligned uniformly).
There are maybe 6 other steps but you should study these things before you make sure if these are real.
summary: You don't know what you're buying.

reviewText: Very sturdy and lots of potential.  Labrador/German Shepard looks great in it.  Size runs true to description.

There are three straps, and the strap around the neck comes with added sleeve for comfort. The chest and abdominal straps do not offer a sleeve, which results in the abdmonial strap of having extra strap hanging as a result of tightening as there is not a way to tuck it away. Though I did learn that that abdominal strap, you don't want to tighten too much, and you want to keep it flexible, for the comfort of the dog. When I tightened too much, my dog could not comfortably sit. Having it looser did not allow for the vest to slide off or be easily moved. My dog is 85 lbs, and I ordered the largest size they offered. My issue was that I didn't want to order a vest that was too small, but after trying it on, I realized that a size smaller wouldn't have hurt. So measure your dog twice before deciding which size to buy. My dog doesn't seem to mind it. With it on, he is able to sit, walk, run, lay down, and can't shake it off even when he tries. The velcro spans the entire top, and the loops are on both sides. Nothing is included except for one velcro patch that I think is intended to make your dog look cool. Although a free sample was provided in exchange for an honest review, my opinion does not change based on whether or not I paid for an item. In this case, I felt the sizing was a tad off as I ordered too big of a size, but other than that, I don't really find anything wrong with it. I'm not thrilled about the abdominal strap, and think it both takes some getting used to and adjusting, but there was no instructions included, so you're kind of on your own.

That being said, I love these shorts. The Fabric does exactly what it is advertised to do, and I feel like I am wearing nothing in the gym which is fantastic if I am running or hitting the weights. This was a sound investment, and I am actually working on converting all of my workout clothes to Tesla Gears. The product is priced reasonably for something you wear for an hour a day, and it does what it was advertised to do. Comparably, the other brands can't hold a candle to this product! I would recommend this to anyone who is physically active, at any level.
summary: No Contest, this is the future of activewear

They are made with thick, soft material with study stitching. The waist is a teensy big and falls exactly between my waistline and navel...which suits me fine since I don't like restrictive clothing around my midline. The crotch/buttocks area could afford to be a little more snug..it's kind of baggy (but not saggy) and would probably be a great fit for someone with a curvy backside! I plan on wearing a tunic so it isn't a personal issue for presentation.

They hug my thighs nicely which helped them to stay up pretty well. The leg length hits a couple of inches above my ankle which makes them perfect to wear with flats if I chose to do so.

Maybe I lucked out but the pair I got matched up the designs across the legs almost perfectly so my fears of being mismatched were put to ease. Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase and fit!

The chest was very snug, especially the elastic empire waist line and I am a 32-34B cup. The dress is made out of very thin, extremely sheer netting material that does not stretch. The thong underwear is made of the same material, and while the waist band does stretch, it doesn't stretch far and gave me a muffin top. The hat is simply a piece of square fabric that you pin to your head with the 2 provided bobby pins. There are also elastic arm cuffs with bows, but they were also very small. Basically, if you're very petite this would fit and could be fun to wear for a short time. I would have been happier with a $6.99 price point.

Do not buy from this seller.  Here's why:

1) The item is not as described.  It is not cotton and has no cotton in it.
2) It is an extremely low quality shirt.  For the price I paid, I assumed it wouldn't be great quality but this is really bad.
3) The logo is clearly used illegally.  It is so pixilated and grainy that they obviously copied it off a website and then printed it on the shirts. The picture below is not a poor quality picture.  That is what the logo looks like.  If you see it in person it's even worse.
4) The tag on the neck of the shirt in the description shows a "Triumph" tag implying it is a "real" Triumph product.  It is not.  In fact, there are no tags whatsoever on this shirt identifying where it was made and what it is made out of nor does it say the size.
5) They are located in China and it takes a long time for the item to arrive.

Here are the positives: seller contacted me in a timely manner when I had a question; the item arrived on time.

reviewText: Very nice wool coat.  Fits perfectly.  Very warm and comfortable.

Wow, great look, great material ...on the OUTSIDE. The lining is hideous. It's some type of weak, stretchy, saggy material and it catches EVERYTHING. Right away, I put it on and loved the look, fit and warmth, as I wore it right out of the box and it was a fairly cold day. I walked my dogs, fed hay to the cows (it is a hunting jacket, after all) then went for a haircut. I put the jacket on the chair next to me during the haircut and then back on afterwards. When I got home and took it off, there was dog hair, hay AND human hair all inside the lining...everywhere. It was ridiculous. I took it to the tailor (since I couldn't return it at this point) to have the lining replaced and they wouldn't even accept it even after I gave it a good shaking because it had so much hair in it. It took me about an hour with a lint brush because the hairs had literally woven themselves into the fabric lining the jacket. It's going to cost 120 bucks to have the lining replaced which is more than half the cost of the thing. At least I'll have a wearable jacket afterwards and it does look good.

I am 6'3" (191 cm) and 230lbs (104 kg). I typically fit an XL and this jacket was pretty close, it has some spare room in the chest which isn't excessive and the sleeves are a tad long but again not excessive.  I have always been a funky "In-Between" size so a Large would have been too small and an XXL would have been too large so choosing the XL was a good call (If you're in the 6'2" 220lbs range, I'd get a Size Large). The jacket is warm, the wool seems to be pretty good quality (80% Wool/20% Nylon Blend), and the liner is comfortable (100% Polyester).

The Pros: It looks nice and can be warn with casual or business casual attire. It seems well constructed and it's warm.

The Cons: I thought Woolrich products were made in the USA but this Jacket says, Made In China.  It has plastic snaps instead of buttons on the front which is odd because the cuff  and collar have buttons. It has a plastic zipper that seems a little cheap.

I'd recommend this jacket for sure, but be aware of the size.

reviewText:
I'm frustrated because I was really excited for this purchase. When you first get them, they're made of a soft and stretchy fabric. As a girl with bigger thighs and calves, the fabric is a good signal because it stretches more like spandex than most thigh-high socks.

However, the fabric is also the problem. Because of the way these sock are made, they'll get runs in them like tights (I had runs in my socks after wearing them for only a few hours the first time), and the tops will NOT stay put. The socks will roll down constantly and you're gonna feel pretty silly pulling them up all the time. These fit me pretty well except for the very tops. I think they tried to make the tops smaller so they would stay up, but it only exacerbates the problem because it makes them quicker to roll down (I'd prefer they were looser and slid down occasionally vs tight and rolled down constantly).
summary: Impractical to wear, made with fragile fabric

This runs VERY small and is very fitted.  Ordering you usual size or even a size up will not result in a fit as pictured on the model.  I usually wear a medium.  I wanted a loose fit, so after reading reviews, I ordered an extra large.  When received, measuring across the front just below the bottom of the armholes, the sweat shirt measured 22 inches (presumably equivalent to a 44 inch bust/chest measurement).  After washing in cold water and drying for 10 minutes on low heat, it measured 20 inches (or about 40 inches around) so take this into consideration when ordering.  It is also not "straight" like a typical sweatshirt but much more fitted.  While it's not what I wanted it is very cute and a nice quality fabric despite the shrink factor.  It is also cut lower at the neckline than a typical sweatshirt which makes it look really nice. Although it will probably be a little large on her, I think my daughter (a size 2-4) will really enjoy it.  Also, the "navy" color is a very dark navy, almost black.

I have several new allergies and one is that I can only wear 100% natural fabrics in white.  Natural fabrics tend to be thinner and therefore not very warm. This coat is the perfect thickness, comfortable to wear and was a great price.  I will be ordering another one so I have a back up.
summary: This coat is the perfect thickness, comfortable to wear and was a great ...

Watch out for new sock sizing rules. Hanes changed the label so what used to be regular-sized women's socks are now considered "extended size". I ordered these "9-11" socks, but that doesn't seem to exist anymore. I was sent socks which are now labeled on the package "shoe size 5-9" and they are too small for me, (I wear 8 1/2). Hanes now labels normal-sized socks "extended size" (shoe size 8-12).  Make sure to check the "size chart" if you're size 8 and up, and order from a better dealer who is aware of this change and won't just willy-nilly mail out small socks..

Fortunately, I e-mailed the seller, who was very receptive. Someone answered my message right away and assured me that it would arrive on time. In fact, the dress arrived a week earlier than expected.
The dress is very stunning and more elegant than anticipated. The color is a clear, light, sky blue.  The fabric and rhinestones were better quality than I had expected especially for the price. The dress is very flattering and makes one appear taller. Since I was able to send my exact measurements, the dress fits well. The only problem I found was that the train was longer than expected which makes it difficult to walk around. I will probably get it shortened. Overall, I highly recommend it.
